results.title: One good reason
results.creator_credit: Donald Crombie, Roland Beckett and Film Australia
results.brief_description: An examination of the reactions of a career army man who is considering resigning to take advantage of an attractive offer to join a commercial organisation. Stars Bill Hunter as Major Archer.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Donald Crombie, Roland Beckett and Film Australia

results.title: Citizen soldier
results.creator_credit: Greg Reading, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Telemark Productions
results.brief_description: An impression of the life throughout the year of a citizen soldier in the Citizens Military Forces. It delves into such aspects as how effective CMF training really is, why it is important to the individual and the country and what it offers to the soldier and to his employer.

results.title: Water skiing
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines basic courtesies and safety rules and procedures of the sport. Cast includes Bronwyn Wright, Robbie Woods. Commentary by Ken Warby.

results.title: Seamanship
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines the three main factors that constitute good seamanship knowledge of the boat, one’s own limitations and correct weight distribution. Commentatory by Ken Warby. Cast includes Allan Robertson, Paul Coolahan, John Kelly, Barry Duncan.

results.title: Miss Mrs and Myths (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
This program looks closely at the wide range of myths and attitudes of contemporary society toward women as members of the workforce. The historical precedents for current attitudes are revealed, and facts, opinions and testimonies are presented to counter the claims of myths.

Originally produced: Adelaide : Open College of Further Education, 1979.
Women as workers (Miss, Mrs, myths) producer, Kay Hannaford ; script, Cate Kelly and Kay Hannaford.

results.title: Search and rescue
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Explains the ways in which search and rescue can be facilitated should the crew in distress observe certain basic procedures. Cast includes Tony Barry, patrick Bollen, Bob Mercer.

results.title: Australia at school
results.creator_credit: Hugh Alexander, Geoffrey Collings and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Shows a range of schools from small country towns through to high schools in Sydney, grades from kindergarten to last year of high school. “A film outlining Australia’s system of primary and secondary education”. Cinematography by Frank Bagnall.

results.title: In-shore waters
results.creator_credit: Rob McAuley, Peter Johnson, Film Australia and RGA Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safer Boating with Ken Warby”.
Outlines some basic navigational and safety rules small craft should be aware of when boating in waters used by commercial shipping. Cast: Alan Doggett, Bob Hicks.

results.title: C.E.P. What's that Got to Do with Being Here?
results.brief_description: The C.E.P. (Country Education Project) is an innovative body designed to tackle the industrial needs of rural communities. The projects are either school or community based, depending on individual educational requirements, and have a full-time regional co-ordinator. Outlines the C.E.P. philosophy and takes a close look at programs currently operating in the Ovens and King Valley regions of Victoria.
results.title_for_label: C.E.P. What’s that Got to Do with Being Here?

results.title: Safe food handling
results.creator_credit: Leigh Tilson, Victorian Film Corporation and Leigh Tilson and Associates
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the need for care when handling food. Disease free handlers, working with well maintained equipment is essential, otherwise food born illness can occur.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leigh Tilson, Victorian Film Corporation and Leigh Tilson and Associates
